comments.content: Correct, routing happens at source and gets "switched" over to the lookuped destination VNI LIF before leaving host over VTEP: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-Data-Center-for-vSphere/6.2/com.vmware.nsx.troubleshooting.doc/GUID-3D5B1AAC-6408-4B41-8691-7D5D51A51D23.html

discussion.content: A. is the correct answer. Refer to the Reference Design p.54.

comments.content: Can't be D as packet will not cross the Control VM, A should be the correct one

discussion.content: The document says that it is always the DLR on the source host that is performing the routing so it should be "D"
The question is asking how a L3 forwarding works, so must be A
I think answer should be D

choices.A: Host A will perform a destination lookup, route the packet, switch the packet onto segment 5002, then encapsulate and send the packet to Host C.
choices.D: Host A will encapsulate the packet, perform a destination lookup, route the packet to the DLR control VM, the control DLR will bridge the packet onto segment
choices.B: Host A will perform a destination lookup, switch the packet onto segment 5002, route the packet, then encapsulate the packet and send it to the DLR control VM.
choices.C: Host A will encapsulate the packet, send the encapsulated packet to host C, Host C will perform a destination lookup and switch the packet onto segment 5002.

questions.question_text: Which three NSX services are available for synchronization in a Cross-vCenter implementation? (Choose three.)
What is required before running an Activity Monitoring report?

choices.D: Enable data collection on the virtual machine.
choices.B: Enable data collection on the vCenter Server.
choices.A: Enable data collection on the NSX Controller.
choices.C: Enable data collection on the NSX Manager.

choices.D: Add the virtual machines to a VM folder in vCenter Server and enable data collection.
choices.C: Add the virtual machines to the pre-defined Activity Monitoring security group in Service Composer.
choices.B: Create a security group in Service Composer and add the virtual machines to the security group.
choices.A: Create a PowerCLI script to enable virtual machine data collection on each virtual machine.

questions.question_text: An administrator wants to perform Activity Monitoring on a large group of virtual machines in an NSX environment. How would this task be accomplished with minimal administrative effort?
Which service cannot be included in a Security Policy using Service Composer?
